TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AuthenticationType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the method of rights management authentication.

remarks.format:
## Remarks AuthenticationType specifies how users who access rights managed content are to be authenticated.
`Internal` also provides authentication for the owner and author of a protected document or template.
## Examples The following example also shows use of the AuthenticationType enumeration.
[!code-vb[RightsManagedPackagePublish#RmPkgPubSecEnv](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/rmpackagepublish/window1.xaml.vb#rmpkgpubsecenv)] [!code-cs[RightsManagedPackagePublish#RmPkgPubSecEnv](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/RmPackagePublish/Window1.xaml.cs#rmpkgpubsecenv)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType Internal = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Implicit authentication to any requesting user.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType Passport = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType Windows = int32(0)

Docs.summary: [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] authentication in a corporate domain environment.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.RightsManagement.AuthenticationType WindowsPassport = int32(2)
